attributes.action: UN decisions should be based on majority voting of UN Security Council members
attributes.additional_details: UN Security Council condemnation of atrocities, inhumane action, etc by a state behaviour is often thwart by veto of one (or more) of the 5 UN permanent Security Council members. UN is currently a hapless and ineffective talking shop because there are too many UN members with differing agendas.
attributes.background: Decisions by the UN Security Council should be allowed if the majority of UN Security Council members at the time agree, provided at least 3 out of 5 of the UN permanent Security Council members (i.e. UK, USA, Russia, China, France) also agree, hence stopping the impasse of veto.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the UN, not the UK Government or Parliament.
